Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Monik79
Reviews.Content: I've been in Le Relais Lyonnais with my husband, 2 nights during our honeymoon. It's well connected and 10 minutes walking from the center of the city (old town). In fact the hotel is in downtown, in the heart of the "Quartier Latin", where there are lots of restaurants and pubs. It isn't big but our room was clean and modern and a nespresso was always available in the room. Good Breakfast for free. Pay attention if you are by car, parking isn't free!

Reviews.Title: “great spot for montreal”
Reviews.Author: AniaKx2
Reviews.Content: we were looking for a reasonable priced room to visit our daughters studying in Montreal. What a perfect place. The host is extremely cordial and helpful. The rooms are comfortable and homey. The bathrooms are very sweet with a skylight . The location can't be better. The breakfasts are exquisite. We are very happy here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay -- you won't be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Wasel
Reviews.Content: I'm probably going to regret adding to the collection of great reviews about this place, because it will likely become perpetually booked and I'll never be able to get a reservation again. I made the reservation online without really understanding where this hotel was located...but as it turns out, it could not have been better situated for us. It is a half-block from a major metro station (Berri-UQAM) that offers 2 routes/ lines, so you are really accessible to most of the city from that spot. Additionally, the area is very walkable, even at night. Yes, there are many clubs and so forth that operate late at night but the crowd seems pretty harmless. We are in our 40s so the club scene is over for my husband and I but the noise didn't really bother us too much. (We stayed on a Saturday night.) I was able to sleep very well, despite having a room overlooking the main street. The room (3rd floor) was smartly decorated...very urban feel, very clean and had all the necessary amenities including free wi-fi and a cappuccino machine. There was a computer and printer outside my room which made it easy to check in for our flight. We were pleasantly surprised by the free breakfast offered on Sunday morning at the restaurant downstairs. More than ample and very good. My somewhat particular husband raved about how skillfully his potatoes were cooked. They also served fresh-squeezed orange juice (imagine, fresh-squeezed in winter in Montreal.) The gentleman working the desk was extremely helpful...he gave us a map and plotted all the places we told him we wanted to visit. He also arranged for a cab for us the next afternoon. Really, this was a gem of a place to stay and we will definitely make this our "go to" hotel in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to reviews”
Reviews.Author: kaece
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights based solely on the reviews here at Tripadvisor. Really not much else to add that hasn't been covered! We took the metro from the train station and were very happy with how close it was to the stop- 1/2 a block. The neighbourhood is very lively- not "touristy"- and we were greeted by some panhandlers as soon as we emerged from the station. They were harmless but definitely a fixture of that corner. We wanted a quick getaway where we could be in the middle of things, and people watch- this is definitely a great neighbourhood for that! Even mid-week in February, many students and locals about. We were greeted by a young man that followed us up to the lobby- we were early but he held our bags for us and was very welcoming. He promptly gave us a map and showed us several sites of interest and assured us we could walk to different destinations. Very helpful. When we returned he brought our luggage upstairs for us. The room is probably the cleanest we have ever stayed in- and the cleaning ladies obviously take pride and treat the room and guests like it is their home. Nice little touches. We stayed in a room at the back- SO quiet! We were amazed that despite its location and small size it is completely quiet. Unlike other hotels where you hear doors opening and closing, other guest traffic, etc... completely peaceful. After days and nights of walking around it was very nice to escape to a quiet little corner of the world! Amazing pillows- all 6 of them! Everything is within walking distance- Old Montreal, food, shopping, Ste Catherine street. We did meet Albert and he really is genuine and charming- eager to welcome you and answer any question. We had breakfast at the Brioche downstairs- after reading the reviews we were excited for it the first day. The waitress gave us menus but then quickly told us that the hot breakfasts were not available during the week- only weekends. We were quite disappointed, but enjoyed the pastry and bread. The next day we were going to find another breakfast spot where we could have a big breakfast- but decided at the last minute to go downstairs for coffee and the newspaper first. A different waitress gave us the menu and assured us that the eggs and omelettes were available- and were included with our complimentary breakfast! Also nice to grab a dessert in the evening. The girls were happy to package it up for us to take up to the hotel. All in all a wonderful little gem in a vibrant neighbourhood- and with the deal found on tripadvisor a STEAL. Would definitely recommend and hope to return with my daughter this spring.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: NEKDueys
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night, but our room was clean and comfortable and fairly quiet. The hotel is in the Latin Quarter, which has a lot of street life, so the rooms facing the street may be noisier, but we were in the back (room 203). The rooms all have hardwood floors, and outside each room is a tray of pebbles for your wet and salty shoes (nice touch). There was no one at the desk when we arrived, but someone responded to the buzzer very quickly and was very cordial and helpful. The Berri-UQAM metro station (which is a hub for most of the metro lines) is quite close, and there are a zillion little restaurants in the neighborhood, so it would be a great place to use as a base for a longer stay in Montreal. You have to go up a flight of stairs to get to the hotel door, and more stairs to get to most rooms, so this might be an issue for some folks. There is parking available in the lot behind the theater across the street. If you are in to big hotels with a spa and room service and elevators, this is not for you. But if you like smaller hotels in real neighborhoods, this is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel with excellent host”
Reviews.Author: nickstudio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicely located on st-denis street right in front of the theater surronded by hundred of shop and restaurant(may i recomend confusion restaurant absolutly amazing) but there are late at night and early morning many homeless, junkies and other type of weirdos around the hotel, but their harmless. The room themselves are amazing, everything you would expect from a boutique hotel and the host is absolutly great. He knows he is highly rated on trip advisor and will do anything for you to keep it that way. Right off we were upgraded to a suite at no extra cost, given free full breakfast for the lenght of our stay (2 days). This place is great for week-end getaway or a night at the theater. They really do cater to your every need. Definatly worth it.

Reviews.Title: “"Couldn't fault a thing"”
Reviews.Author: Dion N
Reviews.Content: The Le Ralais Lyonnais was everything you look for in a hotel, clean, excellently located, reasonably priced, and everything you hope you're going to get. Excellent service from friendly but not intrusive staff also helped to make staying here for the three nights we did perfect. The owner and his staff were happy to go above and beyond even liaising with another hotel for us where we had mistakenly left an item and where struggling with out French. It is also well worth taking them up on the breakfast option as the food in the cafe downstairs is lovely and you aren't restricted to a small section of the menu. The location of this hotel was perfect for us, as we were able to take in some amazing Jazz in the same street, and get to the Bell Centre to watch the Hockey very easily as the hotel is on all but one of the subway lines. Our room was perfect, large modern bathroom with a very lovely shower, and a very comfy bed. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Konglong
Reviews.Content: Great location with many eateries just beside the hotel, conveniently located a stone throw away from the metro.. Rooms are old but clean. Service is excellent with free upgrade to suite for honeymooners and complimentary wifi and breakfast! The only thing is that the room is overlooking st Dennis and is very active and noisy at night. Try avoid rooms that are facing the main street for goodnight sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: DC_Goes_Travelling
Reviews.Content: The hotel is almost hidden amongst the shops lining rue St Denis. We drove past it unknowlingly and had to navigate around one-way streets back to the hotel. Rue St Denis is quite busy so can be tricky to find parking when first checking-in. I was in a bit of a panic when checking-in as we were parked illegally and had 4 large bags plus hand luggage which we needed to offload to the room. The front desk attendant was very calming and helped in offloading the car with our bags before directing my partner to the parking lot around the corner. Whilst waiting for my partner to return, the front desk attendant was extremely knowledgeable and helpful in answering my queries regarding the local area. The building is a converted house which has been tastefully renovated. We stayed in room 302, on the third/top floor which has a large courtyard. The room itself was quite spacious with a seperate living area, a bedroom and a large bathroom with a double shower, a heater and fan. The room was fitted with modern furnishings and heaters in the different living zones. The windows were able to be opened and appear to be double glazed, keeping the warmth in and the noise out. The rooms are very clean, the cleaner did an outstanding job and has great attention to detail - she even folded my pj's! The location was great, close to the train station, shops, restaurants, old Montreal and hospital. Unfortunately my partner experienced extreme food poisioning the last night we were there and was rushed to hospital. Fortunately everything was ok an he was sent home a few hours later. The following morning the owner of the hotel gave me a call to check on us. He was extremely compassionate and understanding and told us to take our time on checking out and even offered to cook up fresh rice for my partner to eat so not to upset his sensitive stomach. I appreciated the support from the staff at Le Relais Lyonnais. Our stay was great, wish we spent a few more days at this wonderful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great little quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: yyyzzz111
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the third floor balcony suite, was a little smaller than I expected and the stairs were a little much, but Albert and this cafe made the stay worth it. It was a little bit of a project getting all of our luggage in and out as parking is difficult in front of the hotel, but the staff was very helpful. The rooms were very modern, although compact and had a European feel, particularity the balcony. The cafe downstairs is wonderful, very authentic and the included breakfast is great. The neighborhood is not bad, it is a residential/college area with many restaurants nearby. Albert goes out of his way to be accommodating. It is a great little quaint hotel if you need to stay in the area or are going to a show at the St. Denis Theatre that is right across the street. I heard no noise at night.

Reviews.Title: “Grossly over-rated mutch better choises to be made”
Reviews.Author: brisbanetraveller
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying in this hotel and location. 24th Sept 2011 Cannot understand how this hotel has the ratings from other guests. The area surrounding this hotel is disgusting the streets are filthy the restuarants and bars are grungy and I have never seen so many people continually begging. While this is not the hotels fault I can't imagine why anyone would want to stay here. The hotel itself is up steep stairs to the rooms and is very ordinary. I went to reception one afternoon 3 times to try and get coffee to enable us to make a cup in our room after ringing the bell each time I eventually gave up I then rang reception still with no one answering. My advise would be for anyone going to Montreal try the Old Town lovely area and nice choise of restuarants and I am positive much better value accommodation. This Hotel and area are one of the most dissapointing choises we have made basing the advise from Trip Advisor

Reviews.Title: “Splendid!”
Reviews.Author: WT40
Reviews.Content: Le Relais Lyonnais is tucked away in the most unlikely of locations adjacent to the University of Quebec-Montreal. The street contains an assortment of first rate restaurants, fast food chains, a fine cinema complex, and a few remaining private residences. During the afternoon and evening hours, rue St-Denis pulsates with the activity of students and other denizens of Montreal. The Metro is less than a half a block away and will whisk you to almost anywhere you might want to go. The hotel is carved out of a graceful 19th century row house. Its six deluxe rooms exude a sophisticated aesthetic with muted colors, dark hardwood floors, and a host of conveniences. We had asked for a room toward the back, based on previous reviews, and found it super-quiet. Albert and his staff were most accommodating, ready to help in whatever way possible, or to answer any question, however silly. The hotels owns La Brioche Lyonnaise, a superb little restaurant and pastry shop, just downstairs, where a complimentary full, and delicious, breakfast can be enjoyed, served up by an excellent staff who go out of their way to make your visit a pleasant experience. Additionally, a simple lunch and dinner menu is available. Albert and his staff also will help you find other places to dine in the area, their advice tailored to your specific requirements. If one is looking for a small, boutique hotel, perfectly situated with superb service, and all at a reasonable price, we would wholeheartedly recommend Le Relais Lyonnais to anyone looking for immersion into authentic, French speaking Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Wendina
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a boutique/B&B type hotel in the center of Montreal. We couldn't have found a better place. It is cerntrally located and within walking distance of everything we wanted to see. We stayed in two adjacent rooms/suites on the top floor that were clean, large and well appointed; really a treat. A restaurant associated with the hotel provided delicious food at a reasonable price; especially breakfast that came as part of our package. At registration we were treated to recommendations for sightseeing, restaurants and entertainment that was right on. I can't recommend Le Relais Lyonnais more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in the colorful student district”
Reviews.Author: JMD_and_LFD
Reviews.Content: The owner and staff (his son, we think) here were extremely friendly ahd helpful, which made for a nice feeling on check-in. They were very happy to answer questions and give advice. Our room was very, very 'Euro' in style. A little long and narrow for my taste, but had everything, including a bathroom with excellent shower, and was very efficiently designed. Even included an espresso machine. We had a comfortable, quiet sleep, with no noise either from outside or inside. The area is really hopping, and its only a short 15-minute walk from here to the 'old town' and the wharf. Parking is in a lot around the corner, for $20 a night. Breakfast was included, in a little restaurant downstairs, and we found it to be very good - you could pick anything on the menu, including the salmon omelette, so this more than made up for the parking cost.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel in boyant neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Jilmat
Reviews.Content: On arriving by car we missed the entrance of the hotel. In fact it is one stair up above "La Brioche Lyonnais", the coffee & tea-hous of the same owner, where also the breakfast is served for the hotel guests. The hotel is situated in a very busy neighbourhood, near to the university, next to fastfood shops and eateries and right across a movie theatre. The street is especially boyant at evening (and night). You shouldn't be supprised to see a beggar or a junkee. Allthough the first appearance was rather repelling, we learned to accept and enjoy the neighbourhood and we never felt unsafe. The hotel has only 9 rooms and we had the choice between nr 101 and 102 on the first level. 101 is at the street side and is somewhat bigger than 102 that is arrrear. Afraid of evening noices whe chose for 102. We slept very well as there was no noice at all. Both rooms are realy beautifull: design, luxury, fine linen, etc... The owner and his employee Alberto were both very very helpsome and friendly. They gave us tips for evening diner that turned to be excellent. The hotel is very near to one of the main subway stations, which is very convenient to visit Montreal. One (for us Europeans) strange experience was that breakfast was included, but not the 15% tip for the servers. All in all we enjoyed an excellent stay of 3 nights in this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ares5510
Reviews.Content: There is a metro station and lots of restaurants near the hotels. The stuffs are friendly, and the room is clean and cozy. Although it isn't a "big" hotel, but overall it's great and I would recommend to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel â€“ Terrible Location!”
Reviews.Author: HWA02
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights and when we arrived on a late Sunday afternoon we were firstly negatively surprised by its location. The hotel is located between fast food restaurants, shabby shops and on rue St Denise are homeless/beggars (probably even junkies). However, although the entrance is not very welcoming the hotel itself is quite nice. It is somewhat special with stylish furniture and very clean. We stayed in the suite on the 3rd floor with a terrace on the backside. In the beginning we were happy not to have a room with view to rue St Denise but you should know that on the backside you will have a permanent noise of the air-conditions of all the other buildings around and a "discreet fragrance" of all the (fast food) restaurants nearby â€¦ so, nice terrace but at least in summer completely useless. As to the staffâ€¦well, what staff? We just saw somebody when we arrived then he was gone. On our last day the invoice was simply skipped under the doorâ€¦again nobody around. So this is more a B&B than a hotel. The bistro, Brioche Lyonnais, where you can have your hotel breakfast is quite nice (the breakfast not the place). Maybe because of the award, Tripadvisors Choice 2011, we had expected much moreâ€¦too much. The hotel is nice but since the surrounding is very important for us too this place belongs definitely not to our favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: daveramlu
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific start to our 16-day holiday when we stayed at the Relais Lyonnais. We were there for three nights at the end of June. The hotel is situated very close to the metro station and also to the airport bus stops. It is situated at the heart of the Latin quarter, which is filled with restaurants. It is less than 30 minute walk from Old Montreal. The hotel is really charming. At our arrival, we were met by the hotel owner, that truly was charming. He gave us useful tips about Montreal, the practicalities of using public transport, and showed us to our room. You could clearly see that this is a hotelier that really likes his profession and dealing with people. To our surprise, we were also given a complimentary voucher for breakfast at the hotel's restaurant. We had always assumed that breakfast would be at a fee. The rooms are perfectly kitted out, including an espresso (Nespresso) coffee machine, fridge and safe. Unlike the vast majority of hotels, the hotel provides complimentary bottled water. The bed was extremely comfortable, the room was clean, and the bathroom had superb toiletries. However, the best of the best was without doubt the breakfast at la Brioche Lyonnaise, the hotel's restaurant situated at the basement. Excellent coffee, and decent juice were provided. We then had to choose between a wide range of omelettes, or bagels with different fillings. The omelettes were to die for, especially the Norwegian one, which was served with copious amounts of salmon, and nicely cooked with onions and capers. All this was served with freshly toasted baguette. However, for people who have trouble sleeping with noise, I would recommend making sure the room backs into the back of the hotel rather than the front. Although the rooms are properly (double-triple glazed) the hotel is situated in quite a busy road, especially in the weekends. We stayed at the back-facing room, where not a sound could be heard. All in all, a fantastic stay!

Reviews.Title: “HEAVEN”
Reviews.Author: MarcandStacy
Reviews.Content: Spent a wonderful birthday week at Le Relais Lyonnais. The atmosphere is simply relaxed and non-pretentious, but upscale and five star all at the same time. The rooms are beautiful. Most comfortable beds, beautifully appointed bathrooms. Mike, the owner's son, is exceptional with his customer service, spending as much time as it took for two Americans to see, do and maneuver through the beautiful city. Breakfast included is to die for at the hotel's bistro directly downstairs. We would stay there again and again. Tip...ask for rooms in the back of the hotel, the hotel is set on a very lively street.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KipsterED
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is hidden in a very popular area of Montreal. There are not a lot of room but they make up for it by having a really modern feel to the hotel. We stayed in one of the suites for three nights and have no regrets. The bed was comfortable with a huge tv and plenty of room. The bathroom was enourmous, especially the shower. What was really nice was having a deck area to sit around outside ( I suggest bringing a box of wine with you out there :). Staff was friendly and helpful and the restaurant is right outside. My only complaint is parking. You have to either park on a busy street or park a block away in a garage. I can't blame them though, it's a very busy area where parking is very limited.

Reviews.Title: “Albert is a fantastix host”
Reviews.Author: CTSirTravelsAlot
Reviews.Content: Arrived early from a 3.5 hour car trip and was greeted by Albert. Room wasn;t ready but I expected that as we wanted to get into town a bit early. Parking was right around the corner and was secure and easy. Took a walk to Old part of the city and ate at Holder on Albert's recommendation (excellent). Room was ready when we returned. Small but adequate for our needs with a nice bathroom. Centrally located hotel with lots of dinign options. Don't be put off by the earlier review mentioning beggars/homeless. What city, especially one with a university (read: bleeding heart liberals), doesn't have homeless people on the streets??? Anyway, like a dense American I forgot to exchange cash and was headed out to a concert and needed some CDN. Albert was gracious enough to do so (with a kind-hearted dig at the dollar's declining value). I would recommend La Distillerie for some very fresh drinks and The Metropolis as a great venue to see music. All in all a great stay including the breakfast that came with the room rate. The ONLY complaint I had was the AC unit in the room which was positioned at head of bed on the wall. Cold air blowing on one's head all night isn't particularly comfortable. Thanks again Albert!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful little gem with excellent friendly service!”
Reviews.Author: sometimetraveler1234
Reviews.Content: We relied on tripadvisor in picking this hotel, and we couldn't have been more pleased! The hotel is located on Rue St. Denis in a very happening area of the city--lots of bars and restaurants and located close to many areas of the city. The rooms were clean, up to date, and roomy for a city hotel (we were upgraded to a suite at the staff's initiative). If you want a more quiet room, request one that faces away from the street--it does get noisy at night. The staff was super-friendly and helpful. All of their suggestions were dead-on with respect to things to do and places to eat, and they were more than willing to make reservations for us. Breakfast at le Relais's bistro is included and was also excellent. Included is a choice of two delicious omlettes, juice, fruit, coffee, and toast. Parking in a nearby garage (staffed 24/7) is available for $20/day. We would not hesitate for a moment to book here again. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Location”
Reviews.Author: SandraandJerry
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located near UQAM and there are all kinds of people begging and strung out on drugs in the neighborhood. While the room was lovely - a small suite with a small balcony in the back, it was on the third floor and there is no elevator. We are in our 60s and really wouldn't have booked if we knew we had 3 flights of stairs facing us at the end of the night. In addition my husband's room key never worked and 4 times we went to the front desk to have it fixed and 4 times there was NO ONE at the desk - if you need any recommendations or help you won't find anyone there. We booked the hotel because it was number 2 in Trip Advisor - we were severely let down. Sorry but we could not recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect hotel.”
Reviews.Author: PickE
Reviews.Content: This is the place to be. Perfectly located in the middle of a bustling area, next to movies, fine dining, and the subway. Rooms are extraordinary and modern. Housekeeping is great. The two owners are real helpful guys. The restaurant downstairs has the best breakfast ever, great eggs and pastries. They even through in free wifi and have a business center. Its a little noisy at night on the weekends, but its big city living, right? One of the best places I have ever stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Merimaria
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy staying in small, exceptional family owned hotels instead of big chain hotels, this is the gem of MontrÃ©al. We just spend the weekend in this lovely hotel and enjoyed every minute. In the end of our stay I actually felt sorry, we didnÂ´t had more time to spend not only in amazing MontrÃ©al but also here at the hotel. Le Relais Lyonnais is located in an old 4-storey building in one of the nicest blocks of Rue St. Denis in Latin Quarter. The block is packed with French style cafÃ©s, couple of bars, a mirco-brewery and variety of restaurants (Vietnamese, Indian, tapas, sushi, lunch, fast food, 24/7 McD...anything!). Two cinemas (Cineplex & Cinerobotheque) and Theatre St. Denis are opposite the hotel and bus station and a huge library just around the corner. The area is very grounded especially in weekend evenings. We arrived by car, but unfortunately couldnÂ´t get to the parking area the hotel offers for itÂ´s guests, cause most of the roads were closed because of the annual, big biking event. So we parked in a parking hall next to bus station (entrance on Rue St. Hubert), just behind the hotel. The weekend rate was amazingly affordable, 9CAD / 24h. If you arrive here by metro or use the public transportation during your stay, Station Berri-UQAM is almost next to the hotel. On the ground floor of the hotel building, thereÂ´s this fabulous cafÃ© La Brioche Lyonnais where you get the breakfast vouchers. From the street next to the cafÃ© you climb small stairs to the second floor of the building to the reception. During our visit we met three staff members, and they were all very polite and friendly, one particularly talkative, I think he was the owner. Reception is open 9am-midnight, so keep this in mind if you arrive late in the evening. Rooms are located in all three floors, lower ones next to the reception. ThereÂ´s no lift, of course cause the building is really old and thereÂ´s not that much extra space. We were lucky to get upgraded to a suite in third floor and the room was absolutely beautiful. Totally renovated, wooden floors, decorated with very good taste and at least the suite was spacious. There was a sitting area with sofa, terrace with chairs, big fridge, safe, coffee machine, flatscreen tv...Everything for great stay and even more. I agree with the other reviews that the rooms on street side might be a bit noisy, cause thereÂ´s so much people on the street especially on weekend evenings. But I think you canÂ´t blame the hotel for that, the neighbourhood is just so lively and the hotel has this great location in the middle of all that! We had the room from the back side, and it was totally quiet. No noise from outside or from other rooms either. So if you hesitate the noise, ask room from behind. A word about the breakfast also. With the breakfast voucher for the cafÃ© downstairs youÂ´ll get a plate with an omelette of your choice, pile of fried potatoes and some slices of fruits, toasted baguette, orange juice and coffee or tea. You canÂ´t compare it with a huge breakfast buffee, but donÂ´t let that bother. ItÂ´s a fantastic French style cafÃ© breakfast and I loved it. The cafÃ© is open till late in the evening and they have also huge variaty of all kind of delicious delicacies on the menu worth to taste. Only tiny downsides during our stay was that when we came to our room on friday night there was some local teens sitting in our terrace (it is possible to get there from the street behind the hotel) and on the next morning at 8am the fire alarm went on by itself in our room. But this all was nothing compared to all the great things this hotel can offer! I highly recommend this hotel to everyone who prefers small boutique hotels and enjoy lively, bohemian neighbourhoods!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: bps_traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Lyonnais in early April. We were attending a series of concets at the Olympic and the hotel was a few blocks away. Location is great, just a few blocks away from where the Airport bus has its main drop off and pick up point and right by a subway station. There are plenty of restaurants on St Denis. The restaurant right below the hotel serves a great breakfast. Super good omelets, with potatoes and fruit. Didn't reaaly need a lunch after eating breakfast. We didn't face the street, so our room was pretty quiet. We could hear other people walking around every once in awhile. The bed was comfortable. Shower was very nice. Two complaints. The lighting was the greatest of you wanted to read in bed. And the height of the shelf that holds the TV and DVD player. If you are over 5'9" you might run into the shelf. It is solid and it hurts.

Reviews.Title: “Our Montreal experience marred by theft”
Reviews.Author: Nathan Z
Reviews.Content: Le Relais Lyonnais is in a busy, central area albeit a bit seedy. It is in the Latin Quarter in the middle of Old Montreal, Downtown, Plateau and Mile End so if the weather is good and you don't mind walking you can get to all these places with ease, there is a metro station right outside the hotel for trains if you don't want to walk. The place itself is a smaller boutique style hotel with only 7 or so rooms. Albert who is the owner is a friendly accommodating man who is always smiling which is great, and he upgraded us to a suite on the top floor. The rooms are very spacious with all the mod cons one needs when traveling, including a nespresso machine and pods replenished daily. Unfortunately after the 1st night of a 3 night stay, after our room had been cleaned we noticed that our ipod was missing. We travel a lot and normally keep everything in the safe but we managed to leave the ipod on a table at the base of the bed before leaving the room to explore Montreal. We went straight downstairs to let reception know of the theft and the man told us he would let Albert know and he would get back to us. The following morning when we went downstairs for breakfast, Albert told me he heard what had happened, but no one in the hotel would have stolen the ipod and this has never happened before. He told us that his staff had been there for years and wouldn't know what to do with an ipod. I didn't know what to say... My wife and i started to doubt ourselves and later that day went and unpacked all our belongings and re-packed, we turned the room inside out but came up with nothing.... we found it extremely odd that a brand new $350 ipod could just go "pff" and be vanished for good. Upon check out i didn't want to make any accusations and wanted to see if Albert said anything to us, he did not mention it at all. I then went back to our car which was in a car park down the road and rifled through it hoping that maybe it was there and i had forgotten, but no. We then drove to Quebec City minus our music in the car and upon checking in to our new hotel i emailed Albert explaining that we were still without the ipod and that maybe we could claim it on our insurance, but Albert has not replied and it has been awhile now since i wrote the email. We are quite disappointed with the way in which this incident was handled by Albert, even though his staff have worked at the hotel for years and he has had no problem's, a fellow guest might have stuck their head in the door whilst the room was being cleaned and taken the ipod. All we know is that it was in the room when we left and gone when we returned - quite simple really. I own my own successful business (also in hospitality) in Australia, and i would have treated this situation a lot differently to the way Le Relais Lyonnais treated us with this incident. Very bad form for a hotel that we picked using Tripadvisor for it's wonderful reviews. If i was to recommend this hotel or any other, i would definitely remind all fellow travelers to keep all your belongings secured in the safe at all times to avoid any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: Carineaj
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect with plenty of restaurants and bars around the hotel and only a 2 minute walk to the subway station. The parking garage is located in the theater in front of the hotel with unlimited "in&outs". Our room was very clean and the furniture was really nice. We loved the bathroom with the great rain shower. However it was located on the 1st floor right next to the lobby and the window was right on the street which was quite noisy. We enjoyed the complimentary espresso coffee and tea in our room but the A/C was really complicated to set. Overall the people were very helpful and provided us with a map of the city and a list of attractions to visit, even though we had to wait 45 minutes on our arrival because they were on lunch break. The breakfast we had at the restaurant downstairs was amazing: it was nice to eat "real" French products such as an original Pain au Chocolat! The service was a little slow and not as friendly as we expected but overall it was nice. We would only recommend this hotel to people that can actually afford it because at the end of our stay we had the feeling that it was a little overprice for the quality of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Formidable!”
Reviews.Author: lewisstruppi
Reviews.Content: This is a great place, central to the Latin Quarter, walkable to Downtown in 10 minutes and within 30 seconds of a Bixi bike rental spot (www.bixi.com). The rooms are beautifully French with shutter windows, walk in power shower and tons of atmosphere. The hotel is located close to bars, eateries and local activities. The hotel owns the bistro downstairs which is where you head for the hearties Quebecois breakfast imaginable (it's totally delicieux). I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the glowing reviews: it's a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: robertbaldock
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review using the hotel's free wifi, and just packing up after a four night stay here. It's a brilliant hotel: the rooms are clean, stylish, really well-appointed and very comfortable; the housekeeping and reception staff who I have met have been charming, helpful and very friendly; the location of the hotel is convenient and very vibrant (you must bear in mind that it is on a busy street, but that's good if you want to feel like you're in the thick of the city). It's very good value for money, and I'm glad I paid attention to the good reviews. This place definitely deserves all the praise it gets on this website.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary value, location and ambiance.”
Reviews.Author: pathfinder3
Reviews.Content: Montreal was a stop on a university tour (McGill) with my daughter. We chose Le Relais Lyonnais because of its superlative reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed. We were given a room at the back (203) and noise was never an issue, although the Latin Quarter location is known for its nightlife. The room was spotless, very comfortable and well equipped (loved the nexpresso machine!). Albert, the very cheerful owner, was always helpful and treated us almost like family. We walked everywhere (always felt safe) and returning to our hotel felt like returning to a sanctuary. The included breakfast at the patisserie downstairs was excellent with a full menu and very reasonable hours (8-11).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Latin Quarter convenient to city and most activities. Good clean rooms very helpful hotel owner.”
Reviews.Author: Mike937
Reviews.Content: Small comfortable hotel in Latin Quarter of Montreal. 2 minutes walk from excellent Metro service. 15 minutes walk from Old Montreal. Loads of restaurants in area. Hotel owner Albert could not do enough to help and assist with suggestions and guidance. Has a restaurant below hotel where excellent breakfast served ( also other meals and great pastries and cakes ). Wireless internet is free and good,

Reviews.Title: “Great for a quick couple get-away in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Sarassita
Reviews.Content: Had a little couple get-away for my boyfriend's birthday and Relais Lyonnais was just perfect : perfect location, beautiful and comfortable room, delicious included breakfast... all this for a very reasonable price! We had the deluxe room but will most probably come back to try the suite. Thumbs up for this great boutique hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel charmant et adorable”
Reviews.Author: LpLoLo
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the hotel and absolutely loved it.....from the moment we walked in we were warmly welcomed and you would have thought you were in Paris...our room 302 was lovely, warm and comfy, very chic, clean and we were very very happy. Albert and all the staff were friendly, helpful and very kind and welcoming. Incredible staff! We will definitely come back and stay there. When the computer on the 3rd floor did not work for checking in online for our flight home, I went downstairs and they went on and printed our boarding passes...no problem! It is centrally located, closel to downtown, and we walked up and down rue St.-Denis and found wonderful, shops, restaurants and boulangeries.... just a fantastic stay.....we took the Express bus 747 to and from from the airport and that is very easy and convenient as well.....when we left they also let us leave our suitcases for a few hours and when we picked them up, I was given a little box of chocolates from Albert! All the little touches were very much appreciated! There are lots of big hotels around, but f you like the smaller quaint Parisien-style hotels ...this is where you should stay! Also had a Nespresso machine in the room which was great! Walking north on St.-Denis....great shops and tons of cute little restaurants and wine bars.....can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel to stay in in Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: felicia-toronto
Reviews.Content: I am very happy that I chose to stay at the Le Relais Lyonnais hotel in my last visit to Montreal. It is in an amazing location. There is great shopping and restaurants on the same street. The blues club two doors down was especially wonderful. This is a very small boutique hotel with elegantly furnished rooms that are very clean. I enjoyed getting to know the owner. Another lovely feature, our reservation included a delicious breakfast in the cafe under the hotel. It is owned by the same person. The only glitch was that I had made my reservation with hotels.com. DO NOT USE hotels.com. They did not send my reservation to the hotel. Luckily there was a room available, so I got a room. Felicia (aka Muriel)

Reviews.Title: “Charming and friendly boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lu_and_Pete
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 2 nights at Le Relais Lyonnais. We were lucky enough to have our room upgraded to a suite, which was beautiful, and felt more like a European apartment than a hotel room. We particularly enjoyed the monsoon shower head as well as the little touches of an independent hotel such as the lemon verbena toiletries, Nespresso coffee machine and chocolates beside the bed! The service at this hotel is amazing, the gentleman who checked us in was very helpful, and spent time showing us a map of the city and recommending restaurants and attractions. The complimentary breakfast included is the best we have experienced, and is at the restaurant on the bottom floor of the hotel. We were able to chose from the full breakfast menu and enjoyed omelettes with toasted baguette, juice, coffee and fresh fruit. The only minor negatives that stop me from rating this hotel 5 stars are that our room was very noisy. Perhaps this is because it faced the road, however we didn't complain as we enjoyed having a suite so much. This is also somewhat beyond the control of the property, due to it's location. On our first night (Tuesday) loud drum and bass music started about 1:30am and continued until 3am; we were unable to sleep during this time. We also frequently heard sirens and shouting from the street. We also found that the bed (which was a double) was very hard, which affected our sleep quality. The property also doesn't have a lift, meaning that suitcases need to be carried up stairs. Overall we had a very enjoyable stay and would recommend this property to others, particularly for those wanting an authentic Montreal experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing But the BEST”
Reviews.Author: BostonEsan
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of staying at Le Relais Lyonnais with my girlfriend over New Years. I can say without hesitation that the hospitality and quality of service that we received from the owner Albert and his son Michael was second to none. They made our vacation in Montreal a truly memorable experience and I don't know what we would have done without them. From the moment we were greeted by Albert's smiling face at check in until the moment we checked out to Micheal's warm goodbye we felt welcomed, comfortable, secure and very well looked after. This is the true benefit of staying at boutique properties such as this. You are not just another guest at a 100+ room property. You are welcomed like family and you can tell that the owners of this property love what they do. I don't know what we would have done without their numerous and excellent restaurant recommendations, as well as, Micheal's advice on where to go for New Years. The rooms are also very well appointed with beautiful hard wood floors, a very comfortable bed, a shower that I had to drag my girlfriend out of and an excellent location on Rue St. Denis. Funny enough, one of our favorite restaurants in Montreal is also run by Albert and is located directly under the hotel. Don't miss out on their breakfasts and crepes! I recommend the eggs ratatouille and the fresh chocolate croissants. Albert and Michael- Thank you for an excellent stay and if we ever go back to Montreal you can count on us staying with you!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms; overall experience a bit lacking”
Reviews.Author: Will L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a Saturday night while I was in town for work. The hotel is located in a great neighborhood with lots of restaurants and a great night life. If you're driving, it's a bit tricky to check in. First you have to stop somewhere along St. Denis (which can be a busy street) and go inside to check in. Then you get directions to the parking garage, which is not attached to the hotel but is in the adjacent block - around the corner and underneath another building. You park and get your bags from the car and come out of the parking garage onto the street about half a block from the hotel, so you walk a little ways back to the hotel. The room was gorgeous, very well decorated with nice hardwood, exposed brick, flat screen TV etc. The rain shower was absolutely fantastic. There is a "business center" on the third floor. Really it's just a PC with an internet connection. There's also free wireless in the rooms. There isn't a restaurant attached to the hotel, so no room service, but there are a plethora of restaurants just steps outside the front door on St. Denis. Be careful if you stay here on a Thurs/Fri/Sat night - the rooms that face towards the front of the building will be loud until the wee hours of the morning because there's so much nightlife out on St. Denis. If you want a better sleep, ask for a room at the back of the hotel, facing away from the street. The bed and pillows were fine but were not as comfortable as you may find at other hotels. Breakfast is included at the little cafe under the hotel, and was quite nice. Overall it's a very nice place to stay with very well-decorated rooms and a fantastic rain shower in the bathroom. The charms come at the small price of a slightly inconvenient parking arrangement, and a fair bit of street noise for the front-facing rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Montreal Gem”
Reviews.Author: DCguy72
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here recently during the week and loved it. The hotel is in a great location - in the Latin Quarter, close to the gay village, close to subway lines, only a 10-15 minute walk to the east end of Old Montreal (and not really that far from downtown either). The owner was incredibly friendly and the room was terrific - comfortable, inviting, clean, and complete with a nespresso machine! We faced the street, but the street noise wasn't bad at all. We also ate breakfast in the downstairs cafe; decent omelets and good pastries. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: rlimagon
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is a gem in the middle of the Latin Quarter in Montreal. Not only the staff (Mike!) is extremely friendly and helpful (really), but also the rooms are amazing. New, modern and very comfortable, they even offer complimentary Nespresso and water bottles at the minibar. The bathroom is spotless clean and very spacious, with the best shower I have seen among all five hotels I stayed in Canada. The complimentary breakfast at the restaurant below the hotel is amazing, much better than expected. There is a very conveniently located Bixi station almost in front of it. If you want to stay at this part of the city, don't think twice!!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: LouLou7751
Reviews.Content: The moment we walked in and met Albert we knew this would be good. The suite was spacious and clean it had great storage and an expresso machine. It was contemporary in a great old building. Our only problem was we were on the third floor and there was no elevator. We probably would have like to be in the rear of the building so it would be quiet but it really wasn.t a problem. Breakfest was included and what a great breakfest it was.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising”
Reviews.Author: iandrew
Reviews.Content: On arrival we wondered if we had the right address - it didn't look like a hotel. But in the event the staff were extremely helpful, the room was large and modern, location was good, breakfast in the cafe downstairs excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Slieve
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the hotel are lovely and Albert on the front desk was very helpful and gave great recommendations for restaurants in the area. The breakfast in the downstairs cafe was delicious. The one complaint of our stay was when we were leaving, we asked for a taxi to the airport. We were promptly picked up but it was not a taxi as there was no meter on display. We were charged $55 before a tip. On our arrival in montreal we had got a taxi to the hotel from the airport and were charged â‚¬25 before a tip.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, charming, centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: superflygirl123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Relais Lyonnais during our first visit to Montreal. I wasn't expecting much - the pictures on the website do not do this hotel justice. It is just a really nice, cute, CLEAN little hotel. I love it. The staff is incredibly helpful and unobtrusive. When we checked in, we were provided with maps of the city and tips on where to eat, what to do, what to visit, how to get around (bixi bikes) and they even offered to make a reservation for dinner that night! The hotel also has underground parking (around $25) which is very convenient if you have a car. The room was clean and spacious. We stayed in the suite. We had originally booked a regular room, but our room was unavailable so they upgraded us to a suite. There are robes and slippers, a nespresso machine, and everything is very comfy and cozy. Toiletries provided. Excellent water pressure in the shower. Le Relais is located in the Latin Quarter, and it is close to the subway. We used bixi bikes to get around mostly, and it was about a 20 minute ride to most of the places we wished to visit. It is right next to the university, UQAM and le Grand Bibliotheque. Breakfast was included, you get it at the bistro located right below the hotel. You have your choice of omelette, which comes with fresh fruit, toast, coffee, and orange juice. It was hot and fresh and delicious. It is also walking distance from a ton of good restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “#1 For A Reason!”
Reviews.Author: davestus44
Reviews.Content: Although there are more than enough glowing reviews of Le Relais, our stay was so wonderful, I feel obligated to add one more! Our room was stunningly beautiful, as it blended modern design with a coziness that I didn't think was possible to find in that style. The bathroom was state of the art as well. The included breakfast in the restaurant downstairs was delicious and more than we had hoped for. Finally, as nice as this small hotel is, the best part of our trip to Montreal was the owner, Albert. From his warm greeting at check-in to his darting out into the street to bid us a fond farewell, Albert is quite possibly the nicest person we've ever met, and is not only the reason we will return to Le Relais, but the reason we will return to Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and great shower!”
Reviews.Author: luvthatmouse
Reviews.Content: Loved the room and the location was great. Clean, comfortable bed, wonderful rain shower. Thanks for the dinner reservation/recommendation. Will be back for sure! Breakfast was very good downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: freelancemkt
Reviews.Content: Albert was a fabulous tour guide and the hotel was a great find. Our room was well appointed and very comfortable. There is street noise at night from the bars but it is manageable. This is a great play to experience true Montreal and the breakfasts are fabulous. We will go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Luxury in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: DivaTravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed overnight this past weekend, and got a great rate on a 3rd floor suite. It was decorated in a cool, rather masculine style, with attention to detail; lovely bedding, including a duvet, spotlessly clean, gorgeous bathroom with extra large shower, living room area, and a huge deck attached with comfortable patio furniture. A delicious breakfast was included in the price, at the hotel cafe downstairs, and it was great to be right in the heart of the Latin Quarter, with all its' funky shops, pub patios, and entertainment. I'd recommend the Relais Lyonnais to anyone looking for a touch of luxury without pretension on a romantic weekend in Montreal...bravo!

Reviews.Title: “BRAVO!!!”
Reviews.Author: patriciac00
Reviews.Content: Few times in my years of wandering far and wide have I encountered the rare mix that is Le Relais Lyonnais. Although very small in stature, Le Relais aspires big, and it achieves it seamlessly. The rooms-as widely stated by previous reviewers -are edgy , very smartly decorated and equipped. From the moment I arrived for the weekend, I sensed the owners were clearly at the helm here. The staff was polite and eager to anticipate my needs. They were knowledgeable (and very patient )when I consulted them for tips and suggestions on Montreal. Unfortunately, there was a glitch in my reservation(my fault), and they were unable to accommodate me the entire stay. But they eagerly took it upon themselves to book me at a comparable property at the same rate I was paying at the Relais(which was somewhat lower). At checkout time, Mr. Cohen insisted they would gladly give me a ride over there. BLEW MY MIND!! more than true professionals . Also noteworthy, the cafe they own downstairs , where complimentary breakfast is served- boasts the very BEST croissants, coffee and baked goods in general outside of FRANCE. Bravo to the owners! High standards, an unwavering commitment to excellence and a gentle heart will surely guarantee guests coming back to Le Relais Lyonnais time and time again. Thank you for a memorable stay in a superb city.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely well located, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: sonderho
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right in the heart of Quartier latin, on rue St-Denis, a lively neighborhood, especially at night time. It is the perfect location for a stay in MontrÃ©al. We booked the hotel because of the enthousiasm of many Trip-Advisor travellers, and though the hotel boasts about its "deluxe suites and rooms", we would rather qualify them as nice average. We had a small room on the backyard side (in order to be away from the noisy street) and it was far from the size we expected after watching the pictures on the internet. We had to completely unpack the second suitcase as it had to be stored away. In the end, the room was a bit noisy as a ventilator functionned at night just outside the window. Furthermore, the air con inside the room was difficult to regulate (noisy and swinging cold air on all programs) so we ended up cutting it off. The bathroom was close to perfect: rain shower and plenty of room to leave our things. The hotel provides free Wi-Fi. For breakfast we had vouchers for the restaurant nearby (la brioche lyonnaise). They have a variety of meals to choose from, as the authentic french breakfast with the real "pain au chocolat": that was lovely. Unfortunately, the service was a bit slow. Overall, it is a good address if you do not expect a deluxe room.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: mniNJ
Reviews.Content: You have to trust Trip Advisor. Everything said about this hotel was spot-on. The rooms were lovely (we were fortunate to be on the 2nd floor in the back, as it was quieter), clean, had plenty of drawer and storage space, and well appointed. The espresso machine in the room is wonderful, and there are fresh inserts, cups, and cream each morning. Albert, at the front desk, was very informative and helpful, and made great suggestions for both sightseeing and dining. It is located right near a Metro entrance, and with the Metro you can go anywhere, although be prepared for a significant amount of walking, often uphill! The breakfasts were wonderful, and although an omelette is listed as your selection, and they were excellent, we had no problems ordering off the regular menu. Even had a crepe one morning! Add to that, the service could not have been more pleasant, and we don't speak a word of French. All told, this is the perfect hotel/B&B for a stay in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, well worth it”
Reviews.Author: exactlythree
Reviews.Content: Le Relais Lyonnais is a hotel that deserves the rave reviews that it is getting. The rooms are fantastic and the facilities are well worth it. Breakfast in La Brioche Lyonnais is wonderful and the staff are really helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service, Nice Room, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DJBlanks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night at Le Relais Lyonnais. Because the hotel was not full, the hotel upgraded us to a bigger room for free. I was a little leery because the room they gave us was on the second floor and right outside a quite lively section of rue St. Denis. Fortunately, we slept like babies. The room was nice and clean. The gentleman at the front desk was very friendly. We were not familiar with the beautiful city and he gave us some great suggestions for meals, sightseeing, shopping, and nightlife. I was so impressed with this hotel that I recommend it to all of my friends that are planning a trip to Montreal. The location is great. There are a lot of interesting restaurants and bars within a short walk and it is a 10-15 minute walk to Old Montreal, which is beautiful. I felt like I was in Europe. I must confess that there may be better locations in the city but I do not have enough familiarity with Montreal to judge one way or another. Parking was a little confusing (it is in a movie theater parking lot across the street), but we figured it out after driving around the block a couple of times. We stopped at the restaurant downstairs for breakfast on our way out and it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Heaven”
Reviews.Author: PamN99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this boutique hotel/auberge recently and were very pleasantly surprised to find that previous reviews I'd read here were spot-on. Personable, charming and affordable ....The cost of a night-stay included a full breakfast at the european-style restaurant/terrasse downstairs where the menu and quality of food was excellent. Indoor parking at a garage across the street is available for an extra $20.00 per day with unlimited exit /entry which is a good deal for parking in Montreal. The service was bend-over backward quality and our room was quiet and well appointed. There is a Montreal ,landmark Blues Bar a few buildings down the street called Bistro A JoJo that features some of the best of live entertainment that Montreal has to offer.Unpolished and a little rowdy at times but worth a visit for music lovers. The only downside of the Relais Lyonnais is there is no elevator (not suitable for wheelchairs or people with impaired mobility) and although there was a huge attractive shower in our room there was no bath. Not sure if there are other rooms that are equipped with bathtubs-but you can always ask . Overall I would recommend this "simply charming" hotel to anyone who is looking for an alternative to the typical 4-5* modern full-service ,copy-cat ,chain type hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Botique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lacunar
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel. It is located within a 20 minute walk of Old Montreal and a 10 minute walk of St. Catherine Street. It is also located a block and a half from the Beri UQAM bus station, meaning you can take the 747 express bus to/from the airport very easily. The hotel itself is tastefully decorated in a simple but very comfortable manner. We stayed in a suite, which included a small balcony. We also had free internet access; I'm not sure if that is just for suite guests or if it is for all guests. The only drawback we found was that rue Saint Denis is a very busy street and can be noisy at night, even in the early morning hours. Since this is a small botique hotel, the noise from outside can be heard in the rooms that face the street. Otherwise, this hotel was excellent. There is also a restaurant attached to the hotel which is very good. The staff are very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: scarbshine
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary with a trip to Montreal. Le Relais Lyonnais was the perfect place to stay. Our room was modern and comfortable. It is above a wonderful cafe and conveniently located near lots of restaurants. Staff was super nice and made us feel very welcome. Our room view wasn't the best but that was about the only flaw and it really didn't matter. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cubs_14
Reviews.Content: We just had a wonderful stay at Le Relais Lyonnais. We agree with everything positive that has been said on TripAdvisor. Albert and his staff could not have been warmer or more accommodating. Lovely, lovely place to stay in Montreal. Breakfast next door was outstanding!! Note: there is no elevator - if stairs are difficult for you.

Reviews.Title: “EVERYTHING TRIP ADVISOR SAID AND MORE”
Reviews.Author: lauralewis
Reviews.Content: We loved this wonderful hotel and the surrounding area! The service was great and we were even notified that we were getting bumped up to a larger room prior to our arrival! If you are looking for a great hotel, in a lovely area, close to a major subway line STAY HERE! You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Charm, location, peace, and luxury, in one affordable package.”
Reviews.Author: summerafternoon
Reviews.Content: Le Relais Lyonnais is a jewel in the whole tripadvisor/user reviews system. I found this hotel on Tripadvisor; and now I'm just trying to pay it forward. I was a long-time resident of Montreal, years ago, and I was delighted to discover this hotel right on St-Denis. You'd think it would be too noisy on such a busy nightlife street, but my room was an oasis of peace and high threadcount slumber. You've got a great French book store less than a mile away (Marche du Livre, St-Hubert and de Maisonneuve), you've got the ideal place for the 1 AM munchies right up the street (L"Express, 3929 St-Denis), and you're also within walking distance of downtown Ste-Catherine street, Crescent Street, tea at the Ritz, swimming at L'Hotel de la Montagne, begging for change in the Carre St-Louis, and on an on. Normally you'd pay for such a location with bad value in a hotel. Le Relais Lyonnais is five-star value. Did anybody mention their breakfasts, down in La Brioche Lyonnaise? I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: andru86
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel solely based on the reviews that I read on TripAdvisor. Let me tell you.... Le Relais Lyonnais is not No.1 on the list for no reason. After a long haul from Toronto, we were very pleasantly greeted by Albert, where he not only gave us vouchers for free breakfast, but also upgraded our room to a fabulous suite. This hotel is situated right by UQAM, therefore have several pubs and bars nearby. While I was there, UQAM was holding "Law Game" where all the law students gathered and partied until they dropped. It was loud at night, but it was out of ordinary. Hotel is situated right in the middle of Old Montreal and downtown, and I found the location very ideal. You need any recommendation? ask albert he will tell you which restaurants to go to, where to shop.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Impressed with Everything”
Reviews.Author: mejulio
Reviews.Content: Great boutique hotel, clean, well appointed, nice furnishings, great bed and service that is second to none! What more can I say? The owner operator, Albert was a gracious host who knows how to make his guests feel welcome. All of his recommendations were bang on! Now I know why is the the Number 1 Rated hotel in Montreal....

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in so many ways”
Reviews.Author: stltraveler47
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel - everything was just lovely and Albert a delight. The room was spacious and immaculate, the bathroom was wonderful. Since it was our first time in Montreal, Albert recommended and made reservations for us at several restaurants. It's in a great location. Since rue St Denis is a very happening street, it can be a bit noisy on Friday nights if you have a room that overlooks the street, but for us it was a non issue. Can't wait to return to Montreal and will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The TripAdvisor Ranking is True to its Word.”
Reviews.Author: NVLoc
Reviews.Content: This place is my ideal hotel experience. Simple, contemporary, understanded and welcoming. I stayed on the street side my first time there and although the street traffic was busy, the room was quiet enough. Not perfect, but good enough. My second time there was at the back overlooking the atrium. Nice and Quiet - near perfection for a busy downtown locale. Rooms are on the smaller side but minimally, yet thoughtfully finished. Thus, I felt right at home. This place is ideal for the solo/business traveler or couples that appreciate getting out and about. These aren't rooms that you'd lounge around in for the day, but are classy and comfortable enough that when you return from a day out in Montreal, you feel welcome and relaxed upon your return. If awards were handed out for best hotel shower water pressure, Relais Lyonnais would win hands-down. Albert & Louis are salt-of-the earth owner-operators that are warm and friendly yet invisible at the right time. They're available when you need them but, for the most part you feel as though you have the place to yourself which is what I appreciate in a hotel stay. These guys know what they want in a boutique hotel and cater to those that appreciate a similar experience. Le Relais Lyonnais complimented my Montreal experience in a way I won't soon forget.

Reviews.Title: “Five star hotel with six star service!”
Reviews.Author: bfernandez09
Reviews.Content: All the great reviews about this hotel are dead on! This hotel is very quaint but modern and in a great location. It was very close to everything we wanted to do. The room was very nicely furnished and extremely clean. The hotel has a nice restaurant downstairs with great pastries and breakfast. But, what really made this hotel such a wonderful place to stay was the service, and in particular, Albert! Albert and his staff went out of their way to make our stay a pleasant and effortless one. He helped us find everything we wanted to see, helped us call home when we couldn't use our cell phones, and even gave us snacks when we checked out for our ride to the airport!! If you want to experience the best of Montreal, staying at Le Relais Lyonnais is a must!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and impressive atten”
Reviews.Author: exuburanceforhotels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend and was very impressed by everything offered. I loved that it was a small hotel, with just 7 rooms, and our room was very clean and modern. With beautiful wood floors, huge windows, a very comfy bed, the shower with a rain shower head, and the in room magazines and espresso machine, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The breakfast at the attached restaurant was delicious, and, we found Albert to be very helpful and friendly. Next time I am in Montreal I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “It is like family only much, much better.”
Reviews.Author: madforkay
Reviews.Content: Another visit just a special as the last. Albert's wonderful greeting and the attention to detail makes this an always great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: toroooo
Reviews.Content: Albert gave me the room 203 located in the second floor, at the back, and it was was soo quiet! the only thing i didnt have in the description from the website was a fridge.. so he made someone bring me some ice and bottle of water! The hotel room was very very nice! My girlfriend loved it so much! she liked it a lot! the Tv in that room was placed awkwardly, wasn't able to move it. but o well, I didn't really watch TV. I was hooked on the internet with my laptop. the internet' speed was very fast! the shower's water strength was very strong! like the other people's review! Everything was set with a lot of details! Bravo again! I had a late check out with no extra charge! I check in by 19h but i had to go back to work, so after work. we got into our room by 23h and we left at 14:30 the next day! ps: Albert offered us free breakfast! =) if ever I wanted to do another escape! hotel lyonnais will be one of the place i will certainly go to! maybe next time I will take the Suite~

Reviews.Title: “Just do it!”
Reviews.Author: Eileen C
Reviews.Content: This is a first. I am actually writing the review about 2.5 hours after I have arrived. Everything everybody says is true. I am travelling for business and was due to stay for 2 nights but it was cut short to 1 night. How disappointed am I? I am in room 302 - a suite - with a wonderful terrace that I will not have time to use. If I am ever back in Montreal without any hesitation I can say I will check in here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel near to everything”
Reviews.Author: ChrisfromTO
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a romantic birthday getaway for my wife. After reading the reviews of the Le Relais Lyonnais, I decided that this was the place to take my lovely bride for her birthday. The hotel did not disappoint, Albert greeted us upon arrival and was there for our every need. Parking is available in underground parking around the block under the theatre for 20 dollars a day, it is secure but a bit of a walk to the car in the mornings as the elevators in the theatre do not go down to the parking garage until around eleven am. This means that you must walk around the building then walk down the ramps to the third level as this is where they have you park for long term. Breakfast was included with our stay, but if you would like to enjoy a nice omelette, fresh fruit and freshly squeezed orange juice, you must ask about this at the time of booking as I donâ€™t think it is automatically offered. The suites are very nice and modern, my wife loved the shower, it has both a rain head and a handheld shower sprayer that can be adjusted from gentle mist to skin peal. I preferred the strong spray as it gave a wonderful feeling after walking all over the city. There is a computer provided on the third landing with internet access and a printer provided for free, there is also wireless access provided to all guests. I found the signal and speed on the third floor to be excellent. The hotel is about a fifteen minute walk to Old Montreal and is located near a collage campus in the Latin Quarter. The street is lively all day but it isnâ€™t obtrusive or unseemly. The only thing that must be noted is that this is a converted home to boutique hotel that doesnâ€™t have an elevator; the suites are on the third floor that is accessed by a narrow winding staircase. If you are mobility challenged then you should ask for a room on the first floor. You would have to only negotiate the first flight of stairs from the street. If you canâ€™t climb any stairs than this is not the hotel for you. It isnâ€™t the least expensive but for what you get it is quite reasonable. I would not hesitate to book there again the next time I am in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel manager, albert, is the reason why to choose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ori888
Reviews.Content: So helpful, so generous, Mr. albert, welcomed us after a long drive from Vermont, USA, to Montreal. Here in Montreal, a nice suite was waiting for us; the hotel provides free parking in the theatre building opposite the hotel; full breakfast at the coffee shop on the first floor of the hotel in which he is a partner. This is a very popular location for young Montreal Canadians, always busy and there was even a birthday celebration of a young fellow with his many friends having breakfast together. Albert sdvised us of 2 fine restaurants, a Greek one and a French one, both were proven to be fine. The suite was furnished in a contemporary style, the flat large sattelite TV with many channels to choose from, the free WiFi and the comfortable bad all made our stay very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: phoskins23
Reviews.Content: This small hotel with only 7 rooms is spotless, in a great location, and run by a hotel owner that genuinely cares about your stay. Albert is the owner and makes sure you have what you need and treats you like an old friend. This was our first trip to Montreal so he gave us a map and circled areas we "must see" and generally helped us understand where to go. He called and made reservations at a restaurant where the locals go (Le Petite Extra), spoke to them and got us set up at a great table. Parking is across the street around back in an underground garage for $20 a day. It is worth it since parking in that area looks awful and our car was fine. The rooms are cozy, absolutely clean, and have everything you need. This room had the best shower I have ever used and the espresso machine was also great. I will always stay here when in Montreal. Albert also owns/runs the restaurant downstairs which has wonderful breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, spotless, great character.”
Reviews.Author: DebSD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Sept. 27 - Oct. 3, 2009. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary with a week in Montreal, and chose Le Relais after reading about it on TripAdvisor.com - I always choose our hotels this way. We would certainly stay at Le Relais again; we had a great stay and were very happy. We had one of the third floor suites and it was very nicely decorated and absolutely spotless. Bathroom was wonderful - large shower, all new ultra-modern fixtures including hair dryer and electric wall heater, a ceiling fan that actually worked, and wonderful soft towels. Bath sheets and robes provided. There was a safe in the room (always a great place for passports and cash), as well as a small refrigerator which was stocked daily with 2 bottles of water (no charge) and cream/milk for the coffee. The coffee/espresso maker worked well. The bed was quite comfortable (queen size), and the temperature control unit (fan/air conditioner) is remote control. There was a small balcony with two chairs and a small table, which would have been great if the weather had been better. The sitting room had very modern furniture, new and not worn out like most hotels. Floors were beautiful hardwood, with area rugs in both rooms. All very clean. The entire suite was very well maintained and cared for. I am extremely fussy, and I was impressed! We had breakfast provided daiily during our stay - there is a little restaurant under the hotel, owned by the hotel - and it is wonderful. Breakfast is anything you want on the breakfast menu - omelettes, crepes, eggs, wonderful pastries, juice, coffee, etc. It was superb - both food and service. Delicious, efficient, and plentiful. It is reason enough to choose Le Relais! Breakfast with the room is not mentioned on the web-site - make sure you ask when you reserve! The location was great for us. We had chosen to use public transportation instead of renting a vehicle - a first for us when on vacation. We have no regrets. There is a Metro station less than a block away, and it is a major hub - it was exceedingly easy to use the Metro and buses. St. Denis is a very busy city street - literally dozens of shops and restaurants, clubs, coffee shops, etc. People everywhere all hours! Our suite was on the front of the building - if you are a light sleeper, bring ear plugs or request a suite on the back of the building. The noise was not a problem for us. I think the hotel has limited parking, so check when you book. Otherwise, street parking is very limited and busy. Tons of shopping within walking distance. No hotel is perfect - so here are a couple of things worthy of note: 1. Le Relais advertises free wi-fi in all rooms. The internet service was "spotty" at best. At times, it was okay - but more often than not, we could not even connect (we have two brand new laptops, with good wireless cards). I did call the front desk, and spoke to Albert - but there were no suggestions. They also have a "Business Center" on the third floor - it is a desk with computer with internet access, complete with printer and paper supplied - however this computer has extremely limited internet access as well. So - if internet access is imperative, this is not the place to stay. There is a coffee shop a couple of doors down with free wi-fi, and the service there is excellent -as is the coffee! 2. There is rarely anyone at the front desk - in fact, over the course of a 7 day stay, we saw Albert once! This is not a problem, however there are times when it would be helpful to ask questions or seek advice regarding directions, etc. I found this frustrating at times. 3. If you are on the second or third floor, it is important to note that the stairs are relatively steep and long. Good handrails, but it is a beautiful old character building. If you have issues with stairs, you might want to request a room on the first floor. It is a LONG hike to the third floor suites! These three items are simply things that should be considered when choosing accommodation, as everyone's needs are different. We would absolutely stay at Le Relais again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: DCishome
Reviews.Content: When we booked our trip we used the Trip Advisor's #1 rating as our guide and we were very pleased with this gem of a hotel. We did not know it was the Just for Laughs festival and, when our taxi cab pulled up, we were surprised to find out the street in front of the hotel was blocked off and a lively street party was just getting started. We were initially nervous because it was so loud down on the street and we were assigned a suite on the third floor which was facing the street. We are fairly quiet people who tend to go to bed on the early side but we thought "we'll find out soon enough" and got settled in our room. The room was super clean and welcoming. The decor was appealing and it had plenty of space with a sitting room, large bathroom, very comfortable bed and shutters on the windows/door. The shower was to die for with great water pressure and duel shower heads. There was an espresso machine and refrigerator in the room. I thought the A/C was very easy to use and we were able to set the temperature to exactly what made us comfortable.
